primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God is actively transforming the believer into the image of Christ through the 'makeover' of the Holy Spirit, moving the believer from conformity to the world to a cruciform character.

tekstueel_bewijs: that is precisely what God is up to in each one of us
the character of the living Lord Jesus is being formed in the Christian community
the Lord Jesus Christ himself... is the content of our character
be transformed by the renewal of your mind
conformed to the image of his Son
I appeal to you therefore... by the mercies of God
God is up to in each one of us
we are all doing better than we deserve
present in the power of the Holy Spirit
motive power to live sacrificially derives from the Cross

tegenstander.identificatie: The Power of Sin / The World
tekstueel_bewijs: all human beings ... are under the power of sin
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a 'power' that holds all humans, requiring a divine 'makeover' rather than simple effort.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer presenting their body as a living sacrifice in response to mercy.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly fueled by the primary program (God's mercy/action).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Mercies of God → Transformation → The Church
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit → God/Christ ← Power of Sin

the Lord will be waiting for me
God is up to in each one of us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we must struggle for years to develop

voorbeelden: not to think of himself more highly than he ought

motive power... derives from the Cross

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'power' (Pouvoir) given by God to the incompetent human subject.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the secular 'character' (Not-S1) to the reality of Sin (S2), then to the 'better than we deserve' (Not-S2), ending in the source of Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in Christ being the 'content' of character, replacing human effort.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; mentions Rwanda, My Lai, and slavery to show universal disobedience.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it uses ethical examples, it consistently identifies God/Christ as the active Subject and source of power.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: patience is a strong and mature characteristic that many of us must struggle for years to develop

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of transformation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: that is precisely what God is up to in each one of us
he is not talking about emulating Jesus... He says we are in Christ.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Explicitly rejects emulation in favor of participation (In Christ).
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: None (Jesus is Lord, not just model)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Christ's character is formed in us by the Spirit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Strong integration of political/secular character into the theological framework of grace.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'struggling for years' and 'it is given by grace'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: we are assimilated to him in a way that no one and nothing can defeat

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Savoir (Knowing) in the middle section.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (Power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'struggle for patience' is also framed as a gift of the Spirit.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in avoiding moralism while addressing character. The transition from secular 'makeover' to divine 'transformation' is structurally perfect.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Clinton/Dole anecdotes; Greimas shows these are just 'actors' for the actant 'Humanity under Sin'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'hupomone'; Greimas shows how 'hupomone' functions as a modal competence (Pouvoir) given by the Sender.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that despite the 'political' talk, the engine of the sermon is entirely theocentric because God remains the Subject of the transformation.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of Fleming Rutledge's own homiletical theory in practice.
